Comment: Rep. Rob Bresnahan introduced a new bill that seeks to ban members of Congress (and their spouses) from trading in stocks. “I have never traded my own stocks, but I want to guarantee accountability to my constituents,” the congressman insisted.   So imagine the surprise when a site monitoring trades by lawmakers showed Bresnahan to be one of the most active freshman traders in Congress during his first months on the Hill. The 35-year-old made 357 trades up until April 8 with a volume of $4.1 million, according to the site.  [**Read the full story**](https://www.thedailybeast.com/rep-who-wants-to-ban-reps-from-trading-cant-stop-trading/).
Author: thedailybeast

Comment: "If they didn't make it law to ban trading that means what I am doing is completely Legit and legal!"

Comment: It is outrageous that he insisted he never traded his own stocks, only to pull this stunt (typically Republican I suppose) but in the defense of Democrats who eventually pull the same stunt, I believe earnestly that people like me should pay higher taxes and when we work in government should be required to invest in something like the world market/ national bonds appropriate to our risk profile.       But I will not stop holding random penny stocks (even if I became a politician) and refusing to pay a single penny more in taxes than I am legally obligated to until every other sort-of-wealthy person (and wealthier) are all required to do the same.
